content: f o r r a c y n a v h a n r o a l o n u n i u s y r g e n i s t e m d q e c e u d o o w a k f l r o i t t y e u h h a r e r n granny square fingerless gloves tea cake + make by nicola furey - tea cake + make joining granny squares with the right sides of two of the squares facing together sew or slip_stitch along one edge on the opposite side join the top 3 sts only then repeat for the bottom 3 sts this leaves a gap for the thumb the thumb hole space can be adapted to suit simply join more or less sts ribbing for the wrist enure the squares are turned the right way out before starting the ribbed cuff r1 - attach the yarn where you have seamed 3 sts together either end is fine with a slip_stitch ch11 double_crochet into the 2nd chain from the hook and in each of the other 9chs slip_stitch into the next 2 sts along the granny square edge and turn r2 - double_crochet into the bl only of the 10 sts of the rib and ch1 turn r3 - double_crochet in each st working in the bl only slip_stitch in the next 2 sts along the granny square turn repeat row 2 and 3 until you have worked all the way round and created a cuff before fastening off turn the fingerless glove inside out and sew or slip_stitch the edges of the cuff together to join fasten_off you can adapt the wrist cuff and make it longer or shorter by increasing or decreasing the initial number of chain sts at the point where you attach the yarn for a deeper cuff try an initial ch16 instead of 11 ribbing for the top edge join yarn to the top of the glove opposite end of the ribbed wrist cuff and repeat the ribbing stitch instructions around the top circumference but this time only ch5 when you start which will then give you a 4 st wide ribbing edge once rib is complete seam together as previously instructed for the wrist cuff fasten_off and weave in all loose ends yay one glove made repeat with the remaining two granny squares to form a pair of crochet fingerless gloves happy stitching nicola this pattern can be used to make and sell items on a small @teacakemake handmade scale please credit tea cake + make in your written description and labelling if you enjoyed this pattern please have a look at some of my others on ravelry -
